com.github.glusk2.sprouts.core.snapshots

Class MoveDrawing

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.glusk2.sprouts.core.snapshots.MoveDrawing
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Snapshot

    public final class MoveDrawing
extends Object
implements Snapshot
    This Snapshot represents the game board while a Move is being drawn.

    A "touch dragged" event detects the current touch position and returns a new MoveDrawing Snapshot with one additional Move sample point.

    A "touch up" event designates the end of the current Move. If the Move is valid and completed, it gets added to the currentState and a new BeforeMove Snapshot is returned with the updated currentState, otherwise a new BeforeMove is returned with the currentState.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoveDrawing

        public MoveDrawing(SproutsGameState gameState,
                   float moveThickness,
                   int circleSegmentCount,
                   Vertex moveOrigin,
                   List<Vector2> moveSample,
                   Rectangle gameBounds,
                   ToggleSwitch displayCobweb,
                   ToggleSwitch playerTurn,
                   Label playerTurnLabel)
        Creates a new MoveDrawing Snapshot from the currentState, moveOrigin and moveSample.
        Parameters:
        gameState - the Graph that a Move is being drawn to
        moveThickness - the thickness of the Moves drawn
        circleSegmentCount - the number of segments used to draw circular Vertices
        moveOrigin - the origin sprout of the Move that is being drawn in this Snapshot
        moveSample - the sample points of the Move that is being drawn in this Snapshot
        gameBounds - any Submove that is drawn outside of gameBounds is invalid
        displayCobweb - a switch that tracks whether the player wishes to display cobweb
        playerTurn - A switch that tracks the player turn. If ON, it's "Player 1"'s turn, else it is "Player 2"'s'.
        playerTurnLabel - a reference to the UI label to update player turns
